Operation 'getEventOffers' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Event Offers' is a noun phrase lacking action orientation. Description 'Returns Event Offers' is extremely vague and provides no context about purpose, inputs, or outputs. Improved version adds: (1) clear action verb 'Retrieves', (2) domain context about Ticketmaster platforms and North America markets, (3) explanation of required and optional parameters, (4) details about response content, (5) use case context for AI agents to understand when to use this operation. This significantly improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to call this endpoint.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve available offers for a specific event
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all available offers and products for a specified event on Ticketmaster platforms in North America markets. Accepts the event ID as a required path parameter along with optional query parameters for filtering and pagination. Returns a list of offers with details including pricing, availability, and product information. This operation is useful for discovering what offers are available for purchase before adding items to cart.
